summary: I forgot I drew this Aggretsuko thing in my sketchbook! The mixer episode just made me think Tsunoda, Retsuko & Fenneko were...
caption: I forgot I drew this Aggretsuko thing in my sketchbook! The mixer episode just made me think Tsunoda, Retsuko & Fenneko were kinda the typical drama 3-office lady group (the cute one, the severe one and the hero with a bob), so I wanted to draw that.

summary:
Sometimes the best way to focus at work is to listen to a focus or classical music playlist and maintain your zen.

Other times...
caption:
Sometimes the best way to focus at work is to listen to a focus or classical music playlist and maintain your zen.

Other times it means listening to Germans scream about vanquishing their enemies with swords. Guess what today is?

Recommendations happily accepted.

#aggretsuko #metal #screaming #oneofthosedays
https://www.instagram.com/p/BpHwbefnLET/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=w4t3frxqzlw6

blog.name: kingdomofkitten
blog.title: Jacob A.K.A. KingdomOfKitten
blog.description:
I write sometimes. I think that says a lot about my career choices.

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/KingdomOfKitten

My Letterboxd: https://letterboxd.com/kingdomofkitten/

title: Meeting The Families: Part 7
body:
Ryota: *putting his hand in a nearby stream* There’s not a lot I can say or do, that can make up for all those years, Retsuko. But I’m gonna try in one fell swoop.

Retsuko: Just speak, dad. That’s all I want to hear.

Ryota: …*sigh* here goes….when you were born, I honestly couldn’t have been any happier before, or really, since then. I’m not sure if you remember any of those days, but-

Retsuko: I do. You seemed so much more…positive. And happy.

Ryota: Seeing as you were my baby girl, and you had…what I personally felt, was a horrible secret, I wanted nothing more to protect you. Keep you safe. And away from those demons…heh, I forgot puberty tends to bring out the worst in people.

Retsuko: *nodding* Mhm.

Ryota: …that night was hard to go through. I remember so many things rushing in my head, like, “why did I say this,” “why did I do that,” and so on. Many days after, I wonder how much better things would’ve been, if I had never grounded you like I did…would your grandmother still be with us? It’s possible. All I know is I failed on that day. And would continue to fail, for years afterward.

Retsuko: Dad, it’s not all like that. I probably messed up just as badly…of course, I never was told about it until yesterday.

Ryota: …that was my idea. I never wanted you to know, as I never wanted you to blame yourself. It seemed like a good idea to hide that, to keep you happy. Of course, over time, that plan became more and more moot.

Retsuko: Especially with the cold looks you gave me in that time.

Ryota: Yes. *sigh* ……Retsuko, I-I never meant to treat you as poorly as I did. But after that day….I never saw…you. I never saw my baby girl…I only saw my failings. My mistakes. All the things I could’ve done, but never did. I sort of manifested the rage you inherited, and all my misgivings, into…a demon, I suppose. One that took you away, and tried to haunt me everywhere you were near. I was too ignorant to see it was still you. It was always you….just took until last night where I finally realized it.

Retsuko: *feeling her throat*

Ryota: ….how is it?

Retsuko: I-it’s fine, dad…

Ryota: …at that moment, my arrogance…my blind hatred…it all disappeared. I wasn’t strangling a monster, or some failure, or anything like that…I was killing my own baby girl…I suddenly just…saw you. In pain…crying out…oh god…*begins sobbing*

Retsuko: *hugs him* Dad, it’s gonna be okay! I promise!

Ryota: Will it? I’ve done so much to hurt you! I-I should be ashamed to call myself your father!

Retsuko: NO! YOU SHOULDN’T!

Ryota: I SHOULD! ….I’m so sorry….

Retsuko: …dad…*smiles, as she stares directly at him* maybe now we can make up for lost time?

Ryota: *looks at her, in shock….and then smiles, ever so slightly* So forgiving…hmm. I suppose so. If you’re willing to forgive me.

Retsuko: Hey, nobody’s perfect. Plus…I think grandma would want it that way.

Ryota: Indeed….oh, no! The urn!

Haida: *right behind them* Don’t worry about that! *they look behind themselves, and see him, with Ikari, and an…attempt at fixing the shattered urn* …er, yeah, there wasn’t much, I just grabbed some glue, and tape, and then just put as much of the ashes as I could in there. *laughs nervously*

Ryota: …*smiles, and gets up with Retsuko, walking towards Haida* It’s alright. It’ll do, for now….ah, what the hell was I putting this in the temple for? This should go in the house. *looks up at Haida* Oh! Um, perhaps you and I did not get onto the best of first terms. *extends hand to Haida* I am Ryota, Retsuko’s father. Haida, is that correct?

Haida: …*to Retsuko* uh…

Retsuko: It’s okay, Haida. :)

Haida: ….*shakes Ryota’s hand* Y-yes, sir! I have been an accountant for almost seven years now, and I would very much like your blessing to marry your daughter!

Ryota: Oh? *to Retsuko, laughing* You didn’t tell me he was an accountant! *to Haida* In that case, I give you my blessing! *looks down, sees Ikari, and crouches* And who might you be?

Retsuko: That’s Ikari. Your grandson.

Ryota: Ohoho! My grandson, you say? Quite the handsome devil, *pokes his stomach* aren’t ya?

Ikari: Hahaha! :D

Haida: …*smiles* he’s alright, now?

Ryota: “Alright”? My good man, I haven’t this wonderful in a long time.

Retsuko: *hugs him once again* It’s good to have you back, dad.

Ryota: *hugs her back* It’s good to be back.

Rie: *distant* Everyone! Lunch is ready!

Retsuko: Ooh, let’s get moving, gang!

Ryota: Oh, right ahead of all of you! *runs off to the house, laughing*

Haida: Hey, get back here! *to Retsuko* What the hell did you do, anyways?

Retsuko: To be honest? Not a whole lot. We just had a simple father-to-daughter talk. *picks up Ikari* Turns out, after years of resentment, that was all we needed.

Haida: …huh. You think if we have a daughter, I might go through something like that?

Retsuko: You better not, I’ll divorce your ass in a heartbeat! *laughs*

Haida: Heh, alrighty! *they head inside, to have lunch, as the red panda family becomes whole once more*

Haida: *right behind them* Don’t worry about that! *they look behind themselves, and see him, with Ikari, and an…attempt at fixing the shattered urn* …er, yeah, there wasn’t much, I just grabbed some glue, and tape, and then just put as much of the ashes as I could in there. *laughs nervously*

Ryota: …*smiles, and gets up with Retsuko, walking towards Haida* It’s alright. It’ll do, for now….ah, what the hell was I putting this in the temple for? This should go in the house. *looks up at Haida* Oh! Um, perhaps you and I did not get onto the best of first terms. *extends hand to Haida* I am Ryota, Retsuko’s father. Haida, is that correct?

Haida: …*to Retsuko* uh…

Retsuko: It’s okay, Haida. :)

Haida: ….*shakes Ryota’s hand* Y-yes, sir! I have been an accountant for almost seven years now, and I would very much like your blessing to marry your daughter!

Ryota: Oh? *to Retsuko, laughing* You didn’t tell me he was an accountant! *to Haida* In that case, I give you my blessing! *looks down, sees Ikari, and crouches* And who might you be?

Retsuko: That’s Ikari. Your grandson.

Ryota: Ohoho! My grandson, you say? Quite the handsome devil, *pokes his stomach* aren’t ya?

Ikari: Hahaha! :D

Haida: …*smiles* he’s alright, now?

Ryota: “Alright”? My good man, I haven’t this wonderful in a long time.

Retsuko: *hugs him once again* It’s good to have you back, dad.

Ryota: *hugs her back* It’s good to be back.

Rie: *distant* Everyone! Lunch is ready!

Retsuko: Ooh, let’s get moving, gang!

Ryota: Oh, right ahead of all of you! *runs off to the house, laughing*

Haida: Hey, get back here! *to Retsuko* What the hell did you do, anyways?

Retsuko: To be honest? Not a whole lot. We just had a simple father-to-daughter talk. *picks up Ikari* Turns out, after years of resentment, that was all we needed.

Haida: …huh. You think if we have a daughter, I might go through something like that?

Retsuko: You better not, I’ll divorce your ass in a heartbeat! *laughs*

Haida: Heh, alrighty! *they head inside, to have lunch, as the red panda family becomes whole once more*
trail.content:
Ryota: *putting his hand in a nearby stream* There’s not a lot I can say or do, that can make up for all those years, Retsuko. But I’m gonna try in one fell swoop.

Retsuko: Just speak, dad. That’s all I want to hear.

Ryota: …*sigh* here goes….when you were born, I honestly couldn’t have been any happier before, or really, since then. I’m not sure if you remember any of those days, but-

Retsuko: I do. You seemed so much more…positive. And happy.

Ryota: Seeing as you were my baby girl, and you had…what I personally felt, was a horrible secret, I wanted nothing more to protect you. Keep you safe. And away from those demons…heh, I forgot puberty tends to bring out the worst in people.

Retsuko: *nodding* Mhm.

Ryota: …that night was hard to go through. I remember so many things rushing in my head, like, “why did I say this,” “why did I do that,” and so on. Many days after, I wonder how much better things would’ve been, if I had never grounded you like I did…would your grandmother still be with us? It’s possible. All I know is I failed on that day. And would continue to fail, for years afterward.

Retsuko: Dad, it’s not all like that. I probably messed up just as badly…of course, I never was told about it until yesterday.

Ryota: …that was my idea. I never wanted you to know, as I never wanted you to blame yourself. It seemed like a good idea to hide that, to keep you happy. Of course, over time, that plan became more and more moot.

Retsuko: Especially with the cold looks you gave me in that time.

Ryota: Yes. *sigh* ……Retsuko, I-I never meant to treat you as poorly as I did. But after that day….I never saw…you. I never saw my baby girl…I only saw my failings. My mistakes. All the things I could’ve done, but never did. I sort of manifested the rage you inherited, and all my misgivings, into…a demon, I suppose. One that took you away, and tried to haunt me everywhere you were near. I was too ignorant to see it was still you. It was always you….just took until last night where I finally realized it.

Retsuko: *feeling her throat*

Ryota: ….how is it?

Retsuko: I-it’s fine, dad…

Ryota: …at that moment, my arrogance…my blind hatred…it all disappeared. I wasn’t strangling a monster, or some failure, or anything like that…I was killing my own baby girl…I suddenly just…saw you. In pain…crying out…oh god…*begins sobbing*

Retsuko: *hugs him* Dad, it’s gonna be okay! I promise!

Ryota: Will it? I’ve done so much to hurt you! I-I should be ashamed to call myself your father!

Retsuko: NO! YOU SHOULDN’T!

Ryota: I SHOULD! ….I’m so sorry….

Retsuko: …dad…*smiles, as she stares directly at him* maybe now we can make up for lost time?

Ryota: *looks at her, in shock….and then smiles, ever so slightly* So forgiving…hmm. I suppose so. If you’re willing to forgive me.

Retsuko: Hey, nobody’s perfect. Plus…I think grandma would want it that way.

Ryota: Indeed….oh, no! The urn!

Haida: *right behind them* Don’t worry about that! *they look behind themselves, and see him, with Ikari, and an…attempt at fixing the shattered urn* …er, yeah, there wasn’t much, I just grabbed some glue, and tape, and then just put as much of the ashes as I could in there. *laughs nervously*

Ryota: …*smiles, and gets up with Retsuko, walking towards Haida* It’s alright. It’ll do, for now….ah, what the hell was I putting this in the temple for? This should go in the house. *looks up at Haida* Oh! Um, perhaps you and I did not get onto the best of first terms. *extends hand to Haida* I am Ryota, Retsuko’s father. Haida, is that correct?

Haida: …*to Retsuko* uh…

Retsuko: It’s okay, Haida. :)

Haida: ….*shakes Ryota’s hand* Y-yes, sir! I have been an accountant for almost seven years now, and I would very much like your blessing to marry your daughter!

Ryota: Oh? *to Retsuko, laughing* You didn’t tell me he was an accountant! *to Haida* In that case, I give you my blessing! *looks down, sees Ikari, and crouches* And who might you be?

Retsuko: That’s Ikari. Your grandson.

Ryota: Ohoho! My grandson, you say? Quite the handsome devil, *pokes his stomach* aren’t ya?

Ikari: Hahaha! :D

Haida: …*smiles* he’s alright, now?

Ryota: “Alright”? My good man, I haven’t this wonderful in a long time.

Retsuko: *hugs him once again* It’s good to have you back, dad.

Ryota: *hugs her back* It’s good to be back.

Rie: *distant* Everyone! Lunch is ready!

Retsuko: Ooh, let’s get moving, gang!

Ryota: Oh, right ahead of all of you! *runs off to the house, laughing*

Haida: Hey, get back here! *to Retsuko* What the hell did you do, anyways?

Retsuko: To be honest? Not a whole lot. We just had a simple father-to-daughter talk. *picks up Ikari* Turns out, after years of resentment, that was all we needed.

Haida: …huh. You think if we have a daughter, I might go through something like that?

Retsuko: You better not, I’ll divorce your ass in a heartbeat! *laughs*

Haida: Heh, alrighty! *they head inside, to have lunch, as the red panda family becomes whole once more*
